intro: Cynoglossum badghysii, commonly known as the Afghan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. It has a compact growth habit with upright stems and is often found in alpine meadows. Cynoglossum badghysii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
